head.title: A Moment for a Man, a Faith and a Campaign

hedline.hl1: A Moment for a Man, a Faith and a Campaign

block.p: Re ''To Speak With One's Own Voice,'' by Samuel G. Freedman (Op-Ed, Aug. 8):
Re ''To Speak With One's Own Voice,'' by Samuel G. Freedman (Op-Ed, Aug. 8):
As a middle-aged Democrat and an active member of several Jewish communities, I have mixed feelings about Joseph I. Lieberman's political record and philosophy.

But I have no mixed feelings about Sandy Koufax's bold and, at the time, risky refusal to play baseball in the World Series on Yom Kippur in 1965. Mr. Freedman derogates Koufax for just ''making a show'' of not playing ball on Yom Kippur. In fact, Koufax's decision was a source of great pride and comfort to a whole generation of American Jewish youth.
The writer is professor of law at the University of Miami.
